channel.title: Alaska HDTV | Portable Format
channel.description: Alaska HDTV is a series of shows produced in high definition sharing the Alaska experience with a global audience. Become an Alaska Insider today!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Alaska HDTV | Portable Format
channel.itunes:summary: Alaska HDTV is a series of shows produced in high definition with a dedication to sharing the Alaska experience with a global audience. Your host Scott Slone extends a real life experience for the viewer - allowing you to connect with the location and the adventure. Join us into Alaska!
channel.itunes:author: Scott Slone
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an Alaska HDTV XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use. -Enjoy the Show!

item.title: Adventure Travel | Orca Island Cabins
item.description: Travel with Scott to Orca Island Cabins located 40 minutes by boat from Seward to the private island. Experience Wilderness, Nature, and Solitude in this unexpected corner of Alaska. More on this show and others like it at: http://www.alaskahdtv.com
item.itunes:author: Scott Slone
item.author: alaskahdtv@gmail.com (Scott Slone)

item.title: SanitySaver | For the Birds
item.description: After much needed rain here in Anchorage, Scott decided to take his camera out to some of his favorite wetlands here in Anchorage area. Enjoy this weeks Sanity Saver "For the Birds" More on this show and others like it at www.alaskahdtv.com

item.title: Hike of the Week | Campbell Creek Tract-Bicentennial Park
item.description: Anchorage Alaska Hike Enjoy an Easy family friendly trail right here in Anchorage. A few hills scattered here and there but pretty much level. If desired, some trails gently slope up the Chugach Mountains. More information on this hike at: http://www.alaskahdtv.com

item.title: Adventure | Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes
item.description: The Valley of the Ten Thousand Smokes, a forty square mile, 100 to 700 foot deep ash flow deposited by Novarupta Volcano. Join Alaska HDTV as we take you into the heart of Katmai National Park to view this amazing area.

item.title: Alaska Vacation Stimulus Giveaway
item.description: Jumpstart your Alaska vacation with this incredible four-day/three-night giveaway from Alaska Airlines, Princess Alaska Lodges and the Princess Rail Tours! Visit http://www.alaskahdtv.com/giveaway/ If you're the lucky winner, you and a guest are free to extend your stay in Alaska and see more of what "The Great Land" has to offer. Here's what's included in your prize: - Airfare to Fairbanks and from Anchorage from Alaska Airlines/Horizon Air gateway city. - One night's double accommodations at Fairbanks Princess, Denali Princess, McKinley Princess. - Transfers to/from airport, hotel, train on Princess coaches. - Tour for two on Natural History Tour at Denali National Park. - "Three Rivers Tour" for two with Mahay's Riverboat Service in Talkeetna. - Train transportation on the Midnight Sun Express between Fairbanks-Denali, Denali-Talkeetna and Talkeetna-Anchorage.

item.title: Adventure | Kodiak Island Adventure I AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: My friends, if you're planning your summer trips this year let me suggest putting the great Emerald Isle of Alaska on your list! Kodiak in my opinion is the great summer destination hands down. Kodiak offers amazing and wild coastline, fishing, hunting, hiking, eating, ocean, whales... and is home to some of Alaska's biggest brown bears! - So you tell me... is there anything Kodiak doesn't offer?

item.title: Hike of the Week | Mt.Alyeska Day Hike | AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: Production note: This was filmed in the fall of 2008 while Scott was rolling tape on a hike with his son. We thought it would be fun and inspiring to get everyone in the spirit of summer hiking! Summer is just around the corner, and spring is a great time to begin planning your summer hikes and adventures! Join Scott and his Son Coleson as they introduce hiking at Mount Alyeska located in Girdwood, Alaska. Mt. Alyeska is a popular local mountain offering great summer hikes for everyone at any level. We took the Tram from the Alyeska Prince Hotel and began our hike from the historic resort Roundhouse. More details on this hike at: www.alaskahdtv.com

item.title: Event | Iditarod 2009 Start Highlights | AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: Greetings! It's been busy here at Alaska HDTV prepping for Season II, and I finally had time to finish putting together the start highlights from Iditarod 2009. Better late then never I hope you enjoy! Make sure to visit our website at www.alaskahdtv.com Cheers, Scott

item.title: Adventure | Winter tour of Fairbanks | AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: Welcome to the Show! Hey everyone, we had a great time visiting Fairbanks, Alaska this winter! We tried to make the most of the short time and hope you enjoy this show about getting out and enjoying the colder season of the year in Fairbanks. More on this show available at www.alaskahdtv.com Cheers, Scott

item.title: Event | SCCA RallyCross | AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: Alaska HDTV Presents: Event mashup of the SCCA Alaska Arctic Region And now for something entirely off the regular beat of hikes, beautiful scenery and the Alaska travel videos. Scott and I were looking for something with a little more motorized energy and dropped by the first RallyCross event of the 2008-2009 winter season. The Arctic Alaska Region of the SCCA (Sports Car Club of America) hosts several car racing events throughout the year, but in my opinion, the rally racing is by far the most fun! More shows like this at www.alaskahdtv.com Cheers, Scott

item.title: Hike of the Week | Silver Fern Trail | AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: Season Greetings, Welcome to the Winter edition of the Hike of the Week! This hike takes us just outside the city of Anchorage on upper hillside to the Silver Fern Spur Trail. This trail system is your connection to a variety of incredible hikes into the Chugach Park System. Silver Fern Trail is a 1.3 mile trail that connect with Gas Line trail, which if taken will lead you up to Powerline trail, Flattop Mountain and beyond! We're taking a short loop today, which totals at 2.6 miles long. To sum up this hike: Close to town, scenic, not strenuous, but has potential if hiked at a faster pace, and never very crowded! Enjoy! Scott

item.title: Adventure | Wrangell, Stikine River | Alaska HDTV
item.description:
Alaska HDTV Presents: Stikine River from Wrangell Alaska

Join Scott as he travels to Wrangell, then takes a journey on the Chutine Warrior jet boat up the Stikine River for another adventure in SE aalaska.  Alaska HDTV returns to Wrangell, Alaska for another multi-part video adventure with our friends Jim & Wilma Leslie at Alaska Waters.

Visit our website: www.AlaskaHDTV.com for more information and complete show notes.

Thanks for watching,

Scott

item.title: Insider Update | Our first catch and release! | Alaska HDTV
item.description:
We're happy to announce the soon to be released first season of Alaska HDTV episodes on DVD! Our first DVD title "Year One, Our first catch and release." is scheduled for release on September 16, 2008. Reserve your copy today! More details about the Pre-order here.

This first DVD of Alaska HDTV shows originally shot in high definition will include several episodes from all or series, such as SanitySavers, Adventures and our Hike of the Week shows. Some of the shows included: Hike of the week with Governor Sarah Palin, ice climbing in Wrangell St. Elias National Park and our roadtrip to Valdez to see the May Day Fly-in. Visit Alaska HDTV for more details about the Pre-order.

item.title: SanitySaver | ZEN the BIG WILD LIFE | Alaska HDTV
item.description:
Alaska HDTV Presents: "ZEN the BIG WILD LIFE"

Enjoy beautiful places around Alaska with a mix of Alaska wildlife. Featured wildlife includes bears of Katmai National Park, bears of AnAn near Wrangell, local wildlife around Anchorage, sea life from Seward, Valdez and Kodiak. Music in this show comes from the amazing guitarist Andy McKee with his song Nakagawa-san from his CD The Gates of Gnomeria, visit his website www.andymckee.com- enjoy the show!

More shows like this one at www.alaskahdtv.com! Scott

item.title: Hike of the Week | Hatcher Pass | Alaska HDTV
item.description:
Alaska HDTV Presents: Hatcher Pass "Unknown" hike.

Greetings Hike of the Week fans!

We originally had another hike planned but the pass was not open through to Summit Lake, so the hike was diverted to a spontaneous location I've not hiked in over ten years. âˆšÃ‡We'll call this one though a very scenic, family friendly, and not heavily traveled hike from what I could see. It's July 2nd as I write this and we've still a fare amount of snow still on the ground with early spring still coming through in areas above 2000 feet.

Enjoy the SHOW

Scott

Alaska HDTV

www.alaskahdtv.comâˆšÃ‡

item.title: Hike of the Week | Tony Knowles Coastal Trail | Alaska HDTV
item.description:
Alaska HDTV Presents: Tony Knowles Coastal Trail

Take an easy hike along the Anchorage Coastal Trail, or take in the amazing views, great people, and wildlife the entire 11 mile coastal trail has to offer.

The Tony Knowles Coastal Trail is the backbone of Anchorage's trail system making it possible to travel anywhere in Anchorage by Walking, Running, bike, skiing, or whatever get's you around without a motor! Wherever you want to go the trail will get you there!

Stay up to date on Alaska! Subscribe to our show at www.alaskahdtv.com

Cheers! Scott

Alaska HDTV Making you an Alaska Insider! www.alaskahdtv.com

item.title: Insider Update | April Showers? | Alaska HDTV
item.description:
April Showers? Global Cooling? Where's Al Gore? Winter in Anchorage, Alaska is not yet over - April 25th, 2008 we recieved 17 inches!

Music by: Ken Waldman www.kenwaldman.com

More at Alaska HDTV: www.alaskapodshow.com

Cheers,

Scott

item.title: Hike of the Week | Hiking with Sarah Palin in Juneau | Alaska Podshow
item.description:
Alaska Podshow HD

This had to be one of the best adventures IâˆšÂ¢ve taken, and Juneau is an incredible place. Since 1906 this has been the Capital of Alaska, so the history and culture is rich in Juneau âˆšÂ¢ Sharing this part of Alaska was tops when Governor Sarah Palin joined us on a short hike up to her office in the capital!

See back in 1880 two guys Joe Juneau and Dick Harris were led by a Tlingit chief named Kowee to local gold reserves at Snow Slide Gulch. Juneau would never be the same as stampedes of miners soon led to the formation of a mining camp. In 1906, this camp had grown and evolved into a district government and capital of Alaska. A little known fact is that Juneau was first named Harrisburg after Dick Harris, but Joe Juneau - as a result of some very effective political arm-twisting at a minersâˆšÂ¢ meeting in 1881 - won forever the name of AlaskaâˆšÂ¢s capital city.

So many today have mixed opinions about Juneau. Some complain because the rainfall averages some 50+ inches each year, but thatâˆšÂ¢s typical for southeast Alaska! ItâˆšÂ¢s the history, people, and adventures that are accessible in and around Juneau that make it one of my top spots. In my opinion and in few words âˆšÂ¢ Juneau is not to be missed. Go!

Music in today's show by:

Blazej Lindner w"The Road" âˆšÃ‡get it at http://music.podshow.com

Cheers!

ScottâˆšÃ‡

item.title: Hike of the Week | Nike Site | Alaska Podshow
item.description:
Hike of the WeekâˆšÃ‡

âˆšÃ‡

It's the new Flattop Mountain Hike!âˆšÃ‡ If you're seeking a family friendly hike with amazing views beyond the popular Flattop Mountain in Anchorage, this gem of a hike is 30 minutes drive from downtown Anchorage.

- Located 30 minutes from downtown Anchorage - Starting elevation: 2,626 ft. - Top elevation: 3,850 ft. Lots of history available, easy trails, amazing views. Please respect the fences placed by the U.S. Army, area might also be closed due to military exercises.. but it's rare.âˆšÃ‡ And if you're feeling bold? Rendezvous peak is also accessible to the northeast of the radar summit.âˆšÃ‡ The path stated on this google earth is the path we took.

More details on this hike available at www.alaskapodshow.com/hikeoftheweek

Music Credits:

  • Klavar @ www.klavar.co.uk or music.podshow.com
  • satYa @ music.podshow.com

Music in today's show and artists can be found at music.podshow.comâˆšÃ‡

Thanks for watching!

ScottâˆšÃ‡

item.title: Hike of the Week | Bear Mountain | Alaska Podshow
item.description:
Welcome to Alaska Podshow's Hike of the Week

Bear Mountain!âˆšÃ‡

Bear Mountain offers scenic views, while also offering a quick elevation gain. This hike is a bit strenuous in parts, and you'll want to be sure the trail has been free of rain, or ice as melting makes these steep slopes a challenge.âˆšÃ‡ The views from the top are priceless, and if possible bring a tent and explore for a day or two!âˆšÃ‡ In the fall season you'll also have the opportunity to see both Moose, Sheep, as well be aware of Bears. There are a few other late in the season perks on this hike, but we locals prefer you keep it to yourself once you make the discovery.

Music Credits: music.podshow.com

  • Null Device "Triangular"
  • Mr. Tunes "Georgian Winter"âˆšÃ‡

Get more information on this hike at www.alaskapodshow.com/hikeoftheweekâˆšÃ‡

Cheers,

Scott SloneâˆšÃ‡

Specific details on this hike can be found at: www.alaskapodshow.com/hikeoftheweek

Special thanks to Jap Jap for the music! Purchase Jap Jap music at www.japjap.net

item.title: Extra | Outtakes for Peace | Alaska Podshow
item.description:
Alaska Podshow Outtakes (Video)

item.title: Hike of the Week | Flat Top Mountain | Alaska Podshow
item.description:
Welcome into Alaska Podshow's "Hike of the Week"

We take you to the famous Chugach State Park! This park offers 495,000 acres of forests, lakes, mountains and valleys located right at Anchorage's doorstep - and the welcome mat is out. Today's Hike of the Week is just a 30-minute drive from downtown places you in prime Alaskan wilderness adventures, which offers the ultimate solitude and wilderness beauty in every season!

For a Map of the area: Flat Top Mountain

Whether you're local, out of state, or from the UK - If have a hike that you'd like to see here on the Alaska Podshow, drop us a message at +1 206-973-7469 and we'll consider it for the show!

Cheers, Scott

item.title: Hike of the Week | Hatcher Pass | Alaska Podshow
item.description:
Alaska Podshow #154 Hike of the week takes you up to Hatcher Pass! This mountainous area is infectious with its grand vistas, and historical artifacts that remain scattered throughout the mountain ranges. Today cabins are left from the Gold Rush, which some still rest on the summit of the highest peaks to the lowest areas of the valley. The range of visitors to Hatcher Pass vary from families to professional mountaineers, itâˆšÂ¢s truly a place for everyone. Todays show we take you up one mountain.

Directions from Anchorage: Take the Glenn Highway from Anchorage. Two miles past the city of Palmer, turn left on Palmer-Fishhook Road, which becomes the Hatcher Pass Road. The Hatcher Pass Management Area is 10 miles from downtown Palmer; Independence Mine is 18 miles from Palmer. Get Directions from Google Maps: Click Here

Post production left us with so much good footage, we couldn't shave off anymore giving us a 12:5 minute show. If this download was much larger than you like, feel free to send us feedback at +1 206-973-7469

Enjoy the show! Scott!

item.title: Hike of the Week | Eagle River Nature Center (Pilot) | Alaska Podshow
item.description:
Alaska Podshow #153

Welcome into a Pilot show for what I hope will become a new segment on the Alaska Podshow. We shot this on the fly, and had no script or storyboard in place - It was great practice getting in front of the camera with a co-host and long-time friend Lelinda.

Love to hear your feedback! +1 206-973-7469

Show Credits: Produced by: Alaska Podshow Host: Scott Slone Co-host: Lelinda Bourgeois Network: PodShow, Inc.

Cheers and until next time, Scott
